release.action:
• Added DependencyCycleException increasing verbosity for detected cycles.
  • Improved the warning messages logged for missing implementations by adding the implementation identifier and the dependency name for which the implementation is missing to the logged message.
Bugfix for unresolved implementations when inheriting implemented specifications from a parent.

Added attribute multiplicity to the <specification> element of the XML module descriptor and updated the model implementation to support property multiplicity of specifications added in the 1.2 API. Added attribute final to the <implementation> element of the XML module descriptor and updated the model implementation to support property final added in the 1.2 API. Added the new XML schema with model version 1.1. Updated the model implementation to support exceptions org.jdtaus.core.container.MultiplicityConstraintException, org.jdtaus.core.container.PropertyOverwriteConstraintException and InheritanceConstraintException.
Bugfix for an incorrectly reported DependencyCycleException instead of an InstantiationException when instantiating an implementation fails and the implementation is requested again afterwards.

Added support for disabling any XML validation of module descriptor files by introducing a system property with name org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.DefaultModel.offline. If set to "true", any XML validation is disabled and no more network access is required when parsing module descriptor files. If set to "false" (default), XML validation is enabled and the system may be required to have access to the remote XML schema specified in any module descriptors' "schemaLocation" attribute.
Improved exception handling by correctly rethrowing caught InvocationTargetException instances.
Added various missing serial version UID fields. Updated to latest mojo releases.

Updated class
  • org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.DefaultModel
    Added methods getPlatformModule() and checkPlatformSpecification() to support platform specifications not defined in the container model. An implementation can have a specification as one of its implemented specifications defined, which does not need to be defined in the container model explicitly. For all specifications whose identifiers start with either java. or javax. and point to a loadable public interface, a platform specification is added to the new platform module automatically without any MissingSpecificationException getting thrown. Note: When a platform cannot provide such a specification at runtime a MissingSpecificationException is thrown. Do not use a specification which the target platform does not support.
Maven POM updates.

Added classes
  • org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.BootstrapResolver
    for resolving schema documents against classpath resources.
Added XML schemas
  • org/jdtaus/core/model/container/module/jdtaus-module-1.2.xsd
    introducing a new target namespace for the module descriptors.
Updated classes
  • org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.DefaultModel
    • Added support for reading module descriptors using the new jdtaus-module-1.2.xsd XML schema.
    • Removed support for system property org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.DefaultModel.offline since external entities are now resolved against classpath resources without the need for downloading any schemas anymore.
    • Updated detection of platform specifications by matching the Specification-Title attribute of the package of an interface against the text {@code Java Platform API Specification}.
    • Introduced a new system property org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.DefaultModel.platformSpecificationTitle to support changing the text detection of platform specifications are matched against. Defaults to Java Platform API Specification.
Implemented features introduced in jDTAUS Core API 1.5.
Added missing validation of message templates.

Updated classes
  • org.jdtaus.core.container.ri.client.BootstratEntityResolver
    Corrected wrong escaping of system id URIs leading to errors due to unresolvable schema resources.
Implemented features introduced in jDTAUS Core API 1.6.
Added class WeakIdentityHashMap and updated class DefaultContainer to use that instead of a WeakHashMap to support implementations overwriting methods hashCode and equals.
Corrected bound multiton dependencies getting removed by the garbage collector leading to sporadic re-instantiation.

Updated classloading to not use the thread context classloader by default any more. Former behaviour can be enabled by setting the system property org.jdtaus.core.container.ClassLoaderFactory.enableContextClassloader to true.

Updated the model implementation to discover meta-data automatically as much as possible. For this any available package meta-data is consulted to get the version and the vendor of a specification and implementation. Any meta-data automatically discovered that way can be overwritten by providing corresponding meta-data manually. Implementation classes can now be loaded by the container by means of a static getDefault() method or by a method named after the specification with '.' replaced by '_'. Dependencies to classes without a public no-arg constructor or declared final (like java.util.Locale) are now supported. Default implementations are now discovered automatically for any automatically discovered specification providing a static getDefault method and can be overwritten manually.
Updated any references to the jDTAUS server to point to the SF.net servers.
Corrected GPG signatures.
Maven POM updates.
Added support for processing META-INF/jdtaus/container.xslt stylesheets after parsing module resources.
